00039 /****************************************************************************
00040  *  Global Structures
00041  ****************************************************************************/
00042 /**
00043  *  @brief  Problem data structure.
00044  */
00045 typedef struct arrow_problem
00046 {
00047     int size;           /**< problem size */
00048     CCdatagroup data;   /**< Concorde data structure for problem. */
00049     int shallow;        /**< indicates use of shallow copy of data */
00050     char *name;         /**< name of problem (can be NULL) */
00051     
00052     /**
00053      *  @brief  Returns the cost between node i and node j.
00054      *  @param  this [in] problem data
00055      *  @param  i [in] node i
00056      *  @param  j [in] node j
00057      *  @return cost between node i and j.
00058      */
00059     int (*get_cost)(struct arrow_problem *this, int i, int j);
00060 } arrow_problem;
00061 
00062 /**
00063  *  @brief  Problem information data structure.
00064  */
00065 typedef struct arrow_problem_info
00066 {
00067     int *cost_list;         /**< sorted list of unique costs from problem. */
00068     int cost_list_length;   /**< length of cost list. */
00069     int min_cost;           /**< smallest cost in problem. */
00070     int max_cost;           /**< largest cost in problem. */
00071 } arrow_problem_info;
00072 
00073 /**
00074  *  @brief  Binary tree data structure.
00075  */
00076 typedef struct arrow_bintree
00077 {
00078     struct arrow_bintree_node *root_node;   /**< root node of tree */
00079     int size;                               /**< size of tree */
00080 } arrow_bintree;
00081 
00082 /**
00083  *  @brief  Binary tree node.
00084  */
00085 typedef struct arrow_bintree_node
00086 {
00087     int data;                               /**< data contained in node */
00088     int has_left_node;                      /**< true if left node exists */
00089     int has_right_node;                     /**< true if right node exists */
00090     struct arrow_bintree_node *left_node;   /**< left node */
00091     struct arrow_bintree_node *right_node;  /**< right node */
00092 } arrow_bintree_node;

00095 /****************************************************************************
00096  *  bbssp.c
00097  ****************************************************************************/
00098 /**
00099  *  @brief  BBSSP solver result
00100  */
00101 typedef struct arrow_bbssp_result
00102 {
00103     int obj_value;          /**< objective value */
00104     double total_time;      /**< total time */
00105 } arrow_bbssp_result;
00106  
00107 /**
00108  *  @brief  Solves the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem 
00109  *          (BBSSP) on the given problem.
00110  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00111  *  @param  result [out] BBSSP solution
00112  */
00113 int
00114 arrow_bbssp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00115                   arrow_bbssp_result *result);
00116 
00117 /**
00118  *  @brief  Determines if the graph is biconnected using only edges with costs
00119             less than or equal to the given value.
00120  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00121  *  @param  max_cost [in] value to check biconnectivity question against
00122  *  @param  result [out] ARROW_TRUE if biconnected, ARROW_FALSE otherwise.
00123  */
00124 int
00125 arrow_bbssp_biconnected(arrow_problem *problem, int max_cost, int *result);

00210 /****************************************************************************
00211  *  tsp.c
00212  ****************************************************************************/
00213 /**
00214  *  @brief  TSP result (including result from LK heuristic)
00215  */
00216 typedef struct arrow_tsp_result
00217 {
00218     int found_tour;         /**< true if a tour was found, false otherwise */
00219     double tour_length;     /**< tour length */
00220     int *tour;              /**< tour that was found in node-node format */
00221     double total_time;      /**< total time */
00222 } arrow_tsp_result;
00223 
00224 /**
00225  *  @brief  LK algorithm parameters
00226  */
00227 typedef struct arrow_tsp_lk_params
00228 {
00229     int stall_count;        /**< the max number of 4-swap kicks to perform
00230                                  without making progress */
00231     int kicks;              /**< the number of 4-swap kicks to perform */
00232     int kick_type;          /**< the type of kick: one of CC_LK_RANDOM_KICK, 
00233                                  CC_LK_GEOMETRIC_KICK, or CC_LK_CLOSE_KICK;
00234                                  see Concorde documentation for more info */
00235     double time_bound;      /**< stop after this running time reached; set to 
00236                                  0 to have no time bound, must be positive */
00237     double length_bound;    /**< stop after finding tour of this length; must
00238                                  be non-negative */
00239     int *initial_tour;      /**< initial tour (may be NULL) */
00240 } arrow_tsp_lk_params;
00241 
00242 /**
00243  *  @brief  Initializes the TSP result structure.
00244  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00245  *  @param  result [out] TSP result structure
00246  */
00247 void
00248 arrow_tsp_result_init(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_tsp_result *result);
00249 
00250 /**
00251  *  @brief  Destructs a TSP result structure.
00252  *  @param  result [out] TSP result structure
00253  */
00254 void
00255 arrow_tsp_result_destruct(arrow_tsp_result *result);
00256 
00257 /**
00258  *  @brief  Sets default parameters for Lin-Kernighan heuristic:
00259  *              - stall_count = problem->size
00260  *              - kicks = 0
00261  *              - kick_type = CC_LK_GEOMETRIC_KICK
00262  *              - time_bound = 0.0
00263  *              - length_bound = 0.0
00264  *              - initial_tour = NULL
00265  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00266  *  @param  params [out] LK parameters structure
00267  */
00268 void
00269 arrow_tsp_lk_params_default(arrow_problem *problem,
00270                             arrow_tsp_lk_params *params);
00271 
00272 /**
00273  *  @brief  Solves TSP with Concorde's exact solver.
00274  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00275  *  @param  in_tour [in] an initial tour (can be NULL)
00276  *  @param  result [out] TSP solution
00277  */
00278 int 
00279 arrow_tsp_exact_solve(arrow_problem *problem, int *in_tour, 
00280                       arrow_tsp_result *result);

00310 /**
00311  *  @brief  Redirects STDOUT stream to a file (can be used
00312  *      to completely surpress output by directing to /dev/null).
00313  *  @param  filename [in] name of file to direct STDOUT to
00314  *  @param  old_stream [out] existing file handle for STDOUT stream 
00315  *      (necessary for restoring stream afterwards)
00316  */
00317 void
00318 arrow_util_redirect_stdout_to_file(const char *filename, int *old_stream);

00320 /**

00323  */
00324 void
00325 arrow_util_restore_stdout(int old_stream);
